newsitem.title: FINLAND: LANSIVOIMA SAYS IVO TO REDEEM SHARES, BONDS.
newsitem.headline: LANSIVOIMA SAYS IVO TO REDEEM SHARES, BONDS.

text.p: Finnish energy group Lansivoima Oy said on Thursday state-owned energy group Imatran Voima Oy (IVO) was obliged to redeem Lansivoima's shares and bonds after IVO raised its Lansivoima stake to above one third in November.
"The redemption price is 219.45 markka per share, and bonds will be redeemed at a rate of 107 percent," Lansivoima said in a statement.

IVO was obliged by Lansivoima's articles of association to redeem all remaining Lansivoima shares and convertible bonds issued on March 29, 1994, except for shares and bonds acquired after November 13, 1996, Lansivoima said.
On November 13, IVO raised its holding in Lansivoima to about 45 percent of shares and votes from 31.5 percent triggering the obligation to redeem the securities, it said.
